channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Trump announces on Truth Social that he'll ban mail-in voting and voting machines
item.description: President Trump says he wants to ban mail-in voting and voting machines ahead of next year's midterms. Is it legal?

item.title: Prospective opera singers learn German at a summer language course in Vermont
item.description: At Vermont's famed Middlebury Language School, opera singers perfect their German â€” right down to mastering the elusive umlaut.

item.title: Sand tiger shark conservation efforts pay off in Boston Harbor
item.description: Scientists say that the water in Boston harbor is getting cleaner, leading to an increase in the number of sand tiger sharks using the area as a nursery habitat.

item.title: Bolivian voters signal they want a sharp retreat from nearly two decades of socialism
item.description: After two decades of left wing dominance, Bolivia swings to the right as their presidential election heads for a runoff vote.

item.title: Former national security adviser Susan Rice weighs in on Trump-Zelenskyy talks
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with Susan Rice, national security advisor to President Obama, about today's White House talks between President Trump and President Zelenskyy.

item.title: A new study raises concerns about whether doctors become too reliant on AI
item.description: A new study finds that AI may be causing some doctors to become less adept at screening for unusual lesions in the colon.

item.title: It's unclear where unhoused people are ending up as authorities clear D.C. encampments
item.description: Federal authorities are clearing homeless encampments across Washington, D.C. as part of President Trump's efforts to crack down on crime and blight in the nation's capital. Where are the unhoused going?

item.title: The latest on Trump's meeting with Zelenskyy, other leaders
item.description: President Trump meets his Ukrainian counterpart and European leaders as he tries to broker an end to Russia's war on Ukraine.

item.title: A parent calls on a stranger in a moment of crisis, sparking a lifelong friendship
item.description: In 1974, Surinder Gupta and his young family had just moved to New Orleans, a city where they knew no one.

item.title: Birth control use is up since FDA approved over-the-counter pill
item.description: A new study shows access to birth control has increased following the FDA's approval of an over-the-counter birth control pill. In the two years since the pill went on the market, there's a 31.8% percent increase in people who chose this option after having used no contraception at all.
